benchmark_details.name: DDFA V (Remote Sensing Large Vision Language Models Dataset and Evaluation Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a high-quality remote sensing LVLMs dataset, DDFA V, to address the limitations of existing datasets and proposes an evaluation method for assessing hallucinations in LVLMs specific to remote sensing tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality remote sensing visual language dataset and develop reliable evaluation methods for LVLMs.

data.source: The DDFA V dataset includes five target detection datasets: DIOR, DOTA, FAIR1M, VisDrone-2019, and AI-TOD, encompassing a wide variety of remote sensing imagery.
data.annotation: Combination of model-generated annotations and manual quality checks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of LVLMs evaluated using the proposed RSPOPE method.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on various levels of difficulty in the evaluation tasks.
